page.title: 05COMMUNICATIONS RAFFORD AREA
page.content: There is only one post box in the area.Most people in outlying areas have to either travel to a post box or give their mail to the postman who delivers the mail only once each day. There are two collections from the post box each day. There is only one telephone kiosk in the whole area and so most houses have a telephone.Four people have C.B. radios in the village and they can be tuned into channel 9 for emergencies. If there is a fire 999 is dialled and fire engines come from Forres.Some traders go round the area in vans.If there is a sale or other events of importance then they are advertised in shops in Forres or they are posted on a notice board outside the church hall and sometimes placed on the bus stops.
